body_html:
@MattGrimes and I came up with an idea for testing filter expressions by running them locally against users (like we do with live recipes) without actually sending a recipe to users. We could log the number of users who pass a filter to get a sense of how a filter will perform in the real world.

We'd likely have an interface for registering filters and setting the period over which to test it. On the client we can store which test filters have been evaluated to avoid double-counting, and expire that data after the test period is over locally to avoid storing a bunch of data locally that doesn't benefit the user.

@gregglind @ilanasegall @rjweiss What do ya'll think?
title: Ability to test filter expressions on users
